reviews.text: Well restored national theater of Athens. Two venues inside the same building, the old historic one, beautifully kept, and a smaller space for more experimental theater. Always top level theater performances of the National Theater. You just can't go wrong by attending a theater performances there. Always too quality level word, and totally not staid!!!

My favorite theater in Athens. The building is amazing and the time you spend there always with hight quality. The area is not that safe but it worth it. Take the metro and choose omonia metro station. It is like 2’ walking from there. Do not hesitate to take an outside photo and of course to enjoy any event, just to realize the unique feeling. Sometimes there are offers on the tickets.
Such a superb place to be. Great theatrical plays on the stage, historical building with modern commodities - stage, lights, new wing!
A great theater for great plays, always enjoyed when I visit
Theater always decent but sometimes excellent
There is a lot History in this place worth learning about. I like the fact that it has been preserved. I hope somebody could renovate the grass thatched hoses and keep them in shape.

If you are visiting Uganada and want to learn more about its history and culture, then a visit to this museum is a must.  It is not a large museum but I really enjoyed my visit.  Displays information about the native birds and animals, musical instruments, weapons, tribal masks and head wear and other interesting things.
Endowed with great pieces of history. With very knowledgeable curators. It's a must stop in Kampala
A one stop for Uganda's history & heritage. It houses our most treasured artifacts as well historical national treasures
Hasn't been updated (nor dusted) since 1970 (except for the new oil and gas exhibit). Receptionist was asleep when we arrived.
Awesome place... can spend whole day n relax our mind😍 love to go again.
A great place to go and relax in the sun with a great cool breeze and impressive views of Kampala. Please also respect the surroundings as you are in religious surrounding.
I recommend everybody to visit this place.
It's a cool place free from noise and with a beautiful views of the city (Kampala) !

Serene gardens. 
Quiet if you looking for a place to read
Free parking for visitors. 
Opens from 8am to 5pm.
It was such a beautiful view watching Kampala from this hill. Palm Sunday at the cathedral was colorfully celebrated and very many Christians turned up.
I am a Catholic and I love my religion and respect other people's religions. Happy to visit and pray at this holy place.
If you are a Catholic and you're wondering where toy pray from, this is the place. A lot of history, culture, and faith inspires the Cathedral's existence. You'll love it.
The seat of the Catholic faith in Uganda. That's my 10 year old son Jerry (right) with the Archbishop of Uganda
Very good vicinity, imposing overlooking all the seven hills, a place to be for worship and sight seeing

Parliament of uganda with alot of history about the country and past and present legislators with a public gallery for those interested in following the proceedings. It's open to the public for viewing and you don't pay to access parliament
hehe knuckels lolololol rwanda trees are best trees
Beautiful. Good security and well organized
Good security and facility structure. Centrally located and well organised for legislatures.
Good Legislative House. Old but with mordern repairs

I enjoyed my stay here with my family. I had to upgrade my initial room, a single bed, shared toilet to an en-suite with 2 beds for space to sleep the children. We had a 2 and a 1 year old with us. We used a popup tent and a cott for them and there was enough room.
The pool is nice but busy in the afternoon. They have nice food, sandwiches and BBQ. I didn't go out lots,  but it seems to be fairly close to the city conveniences in a car, though this place is located tucked away and is quiet!
The view is nice out at the hills surrounding as well.

Nice hideaway. 
Privacy is good as everyone minds their own business.
There is a swimming pool and a volleyball coat.
However management limits entry.
Relaxing and away from the hustle and bustle of city life...

Very quiet neighborhood. 
Nice clean rooms. Be sure you choose a room with a bathroom. 

Ordering breakfast, lunch or dinner can sometimes take up to 45 minutes. (But hey, this is most of the times the case in every Ugandan restaurant).

The thin crust pizza's at the bar by the pool are the best of whole Uganda. (Ready in 15 minutes!!!).
Even more freshly made then the "usual suspects" in the pizza home-delivery  business.
And to top thing off, baked to perfection on a charcoal fire.

Nice residence in Kampala. Not of course perfect (like there are holes on mosquitoes web and the room is not clean clean) but the food is good and the service is fine. But the laundry service is not ideal, better do it by yourself or somewhere else.
